toc_entry.title: Scarecrow Cops
toc_entry.description: Anybody can get a job as a security guard. Anybody.

toc_entry.title: Contentshe Frito
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Great fortunes have been made from this unassuming descendant of the tortilla.

toc_entry.title: The Autumn Of Alamo Heights
toc_entry.description: Welcome—well, sort of—to San antonio's dowager bastion.

toc_entry.title: James a. Baker Iii, Politician
toc_entry.description: How a Houston boy forgot his family’s advice about staying out of politics and became the White House chief of staff.

toc_entry.title: Oil Chic
toc_entry.description: Sounds like a joke, right? Cowboy chic was funny too, until it caught on.

toc_entry.title: The Case Of the Campus Crusader
toc_entry.description: Multiple-choice question: UT’s Tom Philpott is (a) the best professor on campus, a selfless reformer, and the victim of an assassination attempt; (b) the worst professor on campus, a publicity hound, and a nut who staged his own shooting.

toc_entry.title: The Shrine Of the Black Madonna
toc_entry.subtitle: Religion
toc_entry.description: Albert Cleage, the self-styled holy patriarch of an ambitious sect, has already won over blacks in Detroit and atlanta. Now he’s set his sights on Houston.

toc_entry.title: Gimme Silver
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Beyond Greed is the tale of the Hunts' journey from silver spoon to silver lust. In Sing Me Back Home Merle Haggard takes a quick look at his life (too quick). Billy Clayton has Gavels, Grit & Glory—or so says his biographer.

toc_entry.title: The Box
toc_entry.subtitle: Crime
toc_entry.description: Used correctly, the polygraph can tell whether or not an accused criminal’s claim that he didn’t do it is true. Too bad the police can't take that to court.

toc_entry.title: French Fries And Sympathy
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Diner recalls the unbeatable glow when the gang was all together. The two friends in My Dinner With andré find that not seeing eye to eye doesn’t keep them from talking heart to heart.

toc_entry.title: They’re Playing Our Song—Again
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: The Pachelbel Canon has gone Hollywood and become the best-selling classical piece in the country. Works by Bach, Mozart, and Wagner are managing to hold their own, too.

toc_entry.title: Mixed Company
toc_entry.subtitle: Dance
toc_entry.description: The Dallas Ballet’s new director is moving the company from traditional works into daring—and sometimes absurd—modern choreography.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: A Texas farmer’s bitter harvest; a truckers’ paradise; Louisiana’s tastiest emigrant; NASA’s lunar fringe; the media’s favorite oilman.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: A new market for unstable oil; Colorado joins the hate-Texas club; Houston lawyers invade Dallas; a Republican litmus test.
